hypothesis_content.title: Post-ETF Flow Reversal Timing
hypothesis_content.statement: In NEUTRAL regimes, two consecutive days of net outflows from US Bitcoin ETFs (>$100M total) that occur without a corresponding >5% BTC price drop creates a contrarian long entry edge, with a rebound typically beginning within the next 36 hours.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Significant ETF outflows in a neutral market that fail to drive price meaningfully lower suggest strong underlying bid absorption, likely from other institutional channels or long-term holders. This indicates the selling pressure is exhausted or being efficiently matched. The subsequent rebound is a timing play on the resumption of normal market function once the predictable ETF selling flow abates. Current news specifically mentions 'ETF outflows' amid a 'holiday lull', providing a relevant context.
entry_conditions: Two consecutive days of net Bitcoin ETF outflows, sum > $100M
BTC price drawdown from start to end of the 2-day period is ≤ -5%
Enter long on the next 4H candle open after the second outflow day's data is published (typically ~08:30 UTC)

exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price drops to 2% below the *low* of the 2-day outflow period

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If the majority of signals see price continue to decline sharply after entry, indicating outflows are part of a larger de-risking trend, not an isolated exhaustible event.
